title: How to Make Pempek Keriting

steps.headline: Place the gabus fish meat in the big bowl.
Pour water into the bowl and add one and a half teaspoons of salt.
Pour the salty water into the meat.
Crack the two eggs.
steps.description: Pour them onto the fish meat.

steps.headline: Knead the dough until it mixes evenly.
Put some dough into the medium size bowl.
Pour some of the sagoo onto the dough.
steps.description: Do not add all of it though.

steps.headline: Knead the dough until it becomes thoroughly white.
Put the dough on a big plate.
Press the dough with the brass pirikan.
steps.description: Continue pressing until the dough comes out curly through the holes in the pirikan.

steps.headline: Collect the dough by using a spoon.
steps.description: Continue pressing the curly pieces out until you have used up the dough.

steps.headline: Drop the curly dough pieces into the steamer.
Steam on medium heat until the pempek keriting changes color.
Remove the pempek keriting from the steamer.
Slice the brown sugar thinly.
steps.description: Add the slices to a pot.

steps.headline: Boil the brown sugar with medium heat.
Add 1 tablespoon of garlic cloves.
Add 1 tablespoon of soy sauce.
Add 1 tablespoon of vinegar.
Stir the ingredients together until the liquid changes color, to a darker brown.
Taste the cuko.
steps.description: Add more salt and sugar if needed.

steps.headline: Turn off the stove.
Pour the cuko into a serving bowl.
Serve the cuko together with pempek keriting.

text: To Make Pempek Keriting Place the gabus fish meat in the big bowl.  Pour water into the bowl and add one and a half teaspoons of salt.  Pour the salty water into the meat.  Crack the two eggs. Pour them onto the fish meat. Knead the dough until it mixes evenly.  Put some dough into the medium size bowl.  Pour some of the sagoo onto the dough. Do not add all of it though. Knead the dough until it becomes thoroughly white.  Put the dough on a big plate.  Press the dough with the brass pirikan. Continue pressing until the dough comes out curly through the holes in the pirikan. Collect the dough by using a spoon. Continue pressing the curly pieces out until you have used up the dough. Drop the curly dough pieces into the steamer.  Steam on medium heat until the pempek keriting changes color.  Remove the pempek keriting from the steamer. Serve it on a plate. To Make Cuko Pempek Keriting Slice the brown sugar thinly. Add the slices to a pot. Boil the brown sugar with medium heat. Cook until it melts. Add 1 tablespoon of garlic cloves.  Add 1 tablespoon of soy sauce.  Add 1 tablespoon of vinegar.  Stir the ingredients together until the liquid changes color, to a darker brown.  Taste the cuko. Add more salt and sugar if needed. Turn off the stove. Let the cuko cool down. Pour the cuko into a serving bowl.  Serve the cuko together with pempek keriting.
